entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: Voldemort's wand is described as moving along the golden thread and connecting to his wand. This suggests that Voldemort is present in the scene.

entities.name: wormtail
entities.description: The ghost of Wormtail is mentioned as flying out of the tip of Voldemort's wand. This indicates that Wormtail is a part of the story.

entities.name: cedric diggory
entities.description: Cedric Diggory's torso begins to blossom from Voldemort's wand tip. This suggests that Cedric Diggory is being resurrected or brought back in some form.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is described as clutching his wand tightly, indicating that he is present and involved in the scene.

relationships.description: Voldemort created Wormtail's ghost from his wand. This is described as a moment of shock for Voldemort, indicating that he did not intend to create the ghost.
Voldemort's wand resurrects or brings back Cedric Diggory in some form. This is described as a large, grayish something made of solid smoke.
Harry's wand is opposed to Voldemort's wand, as Harry clutches his wand tightly to prevent the thread from breaking. This suggests that Harry and Voldemort are in conflict.
